title: Michigan Town Protests Housing Immigrant Children
teaser: Last night, about 75 people in the tiny town of Vassar protested the possibility that some of the kids might be brought to a shelter there.
contentencoded:
The debate and turmoil over what to do with the thousands of unaccompanied children arriving in the U.S. from Central America has come to Michigan.

Last night, about 75 people in the tiny Michigan town of Vassar came out to protest the possibility that some of the kids might be brought to a shelter there.

Here & Now’s Robin Young talks to Kate Wells, a reporter for Michigan Radio, who was at the protest in Vassar.

Guest

  • Kate Wells, reporter for Michigan Radio, part of the Here & Now Contributor’s Network. She tweets @KateLouiseWells.
